---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

This might exist somewhere else but I couldn't find them.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [86cbeb6135](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21693/commits/86cbeb6135bfd6b90a21c86b4fc3a619245b2c48)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecificLimits.InvPow` (new file)|2130|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Complex.hasSum_one_div_sub_pow`
`+ Complex.tsum_eq_one_div_sub`
`+ Complex.tsum_eq_one_div_sub_pow`
`+ Complex.tsum_eq_one_div_sub_sq`
`+ Complex.tsum_mul_add_const_mul_pow`
`+ Real.tsum_eq_one_div_sub_sq`
`+ Real.tsum_mul_add_const_mul_pow`
`+ deriv_div_sub_pow`
`+ hasDerivAt_div_sub_pow`
`+ iter_deriv_div_sub_pow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I think it would be a good idea to state this with `HasDerivAt` so that you can get `Differentiable` for free as well.
Similarly, a `HasSum` version of this lemma seems useful.
I would expect this to be easier to prove in the other order.

This is the proof that I came up with for the second one without using the first. Am I missing some API?
```
lemma hasDerivAt_div_sub_pow {ùïú : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField ùïú]
    (z w a : ùïú) (r : ‚Ñï) (hz : z ‚â† w) :
    HasDerivAt (fun z : ùïú ‚Ü¶ a / (w - z) ^ r) (r * a / (w - z) ^ (r + 1)) z := by
  convert_to HasDerivAt (fun z : ùïú ‚Ü¶ a * (w - z) ^ (-r : ‚Ñ§))
    (a * ((-r : ‚Ñ§) * (w - z) ^ (-r - 1 : ‚Ñ§) * (-1))) z
  ¬∑ ext; simp; ring
  ¬∑ rw [sub_eq_add_neg (-r : ‚Ñ§), ‚Üê neg_add, zpow_neg, div_eq_mul_inv, mul_comm _ a,
      mul_neg_one, ‚Üê neg_mul, ‚Üê mul_assoc, Int.cast_neg, neg_neg]
    norm_cast
  refine .const_mul _ ?_
  refine .comp (h := (w - ¬∑)) _ (hasDerivAt_zpow _ _ (.inl ?_)) (.const_sub _ (hasDerivAt_id' z))
  simpa [sub_eq_zero] using hz.symm
```

Eric's point is that, once you prove this, you can use [HasDerivAt.deriv](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Calculus/Deriv/Basic.html#HasDerivAt.deriv) to go the other way for free.

I didn't spend the time to check whether it's easy to shorten your proof. The end looks like something that `fun_prop` should be capable of doing, but it seems we haven't made it play with `HasDerivAt`, only `HasFDerivAt`. Probably it's more work to go to `HasFDerivAt` just to build the continuous linear map.
That proof looks good enought to me; I suppose you could try to make it a bit tidier by defining a `HasDerivAt.const_div`

> Eric's point is that, once you prove this, you can use `HasDerivAt.deriv` to go the other way for free.

Yes, I understand. And my counterpoint is that 2 is much hard to prove without 1 and 2 is pretty much for free from 1 so in total I don't think it is true that "it is easier to prove in the other order".

Unless I can try to make `HasDerivAt.const_div` work...

No. `HasDerivAt.const_div` doesn't help as well, this is the best I can do:
```
lemma HasDerivAt.const_div {ùïú : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField ùïú] {x : ùïú}
    {d : ùïú ‚Üí ùïú} {d' : ùïú} (c : ùïú) (hd : HasDerivAt d d' x)
    (hd' : d x ‚â† 0) : HasDerivAt (c / d ¬∑) (- c * d' / (d x) ^ 2) x := by
  simp_rw [div_eq_mul_inv c, neg_mul, ‚Üê mul_neg, mul_div_assoc]
  exact .const_mul _ (.inv hd hd')

lemma hasDerivAt_div_sub_pow {ùïú : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField ùïú]
    (z w a : ùïú) (r : ‚Ñï) (hz : z ‚â† w) :
    HasDerivAt (fun z : ùïú ‚Ü¶ a / (w - z) ^ r) (r * a / (w - z) ^ (r + 1)) z := by
  cases' r with r
  ¬∑ simpa using hasDerivAt_const z a
  convert HasDerivAt.const_div a (.pow (r + 1) (.const_sub w (hasDerivAt_id' z))) ?_ using 1
  ¬∑ field_simp [hz.symm, sub_eq_zero, mul_assoc, ‚Üê pow_add, ‚Üê pow_mul, mul_left_comm a,
      show (r + 1) * 2 = r + (r + 1 + 1) by ring]
  ¬∑ simp [hz.symm, sub_eq_zero]
```
But if people like these proofs better then I could change to it.

```suggestion
lemma Complex.tsum_eq_one_div_sub_pow (w z : ‚ÑÇ) (hz : ‚Äñz‚Äñ < ‚Äñw‚Äñ) (k : ‚Ñï) (hk : k ‚â† 0) :
```
and elsewhere. See also #21821

pullRequest.title: feat: taylor expansion of `1 / z ^ r`
